topics.body:
News post:
You know I think I realized how the situation in Syria is going to eventually be resolved.

Syria before the war had a population of 22 million.  Since the war the number of refugees that have left is estimated to a upwards of 2 million as of September 2013.

What is going to eventually wind up happening is every civilian is just going to leave and let the military and rebels duke it out.  If a million people are leaving a year then in twenty years Syria as a nation will cease to exist.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Then what will become of the land? Do we now name it the Artist formerly known as Syria?

topics.author: 515ddf93a4c72d8a1f000d57

topics.body:
. . . Wait; I stand corrected; per day there's 10,000 people crossing the border and Syria *HAD* a population of 22 million in 2010.  22,000,000(in 2010)-2,000,000(number of refuges in august 2013) = ~20,000,000/10,000per day= 2000 days/365.25(leap year guys)= ~5.48 years or ~5 years, ~5 months as of august 2013 - it's been seven months since august 2013 = ~4 years, ~10 months.  ~Five years from now Syria will cease to exist.

If you're wondering what the ~ means is that it's just another way of saying something is a ballpark estimate.  When I say five years from now Syria will cease to exist I mean around that ballpark; it could be sooner or later depending on what happens.

As of February 2.5 million confirmed people left.  Don't ask for a 100% accurate estimate cause I don't think anyone really knows for certain.  All I really know is Syria is fucked.  Even if someone were to win the massive amounts of people leaving will doom the country economically and population wise for decades upon decades.  To put it simply: it's pretty safe now to take off Syria from the list of nations cause whenever the fighting ends the population will be be massively reduced to the point the nation will not be able to recover.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
